video.name: LENTIL QUINOA MEATLOAF BURGER | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Lentil Quinoa Meatloaf Burger

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here - https://www.veganricha.com/lentil-quinoa-meatloaf-burgers/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Lentil Quinoa Meatloaf Burgers.  Lentil Quinoa Burger patties with spicy glaze. Easy “Meatloaf” Burgers. Serve as burgers with buns or as patties over a salad. Vegan Nut-free Recipe.

Lentils and quinoa and amped up with cooked onion, garlic and veggies, spices, sauces and made into patties. Cook the patties on a skillet and the patty is ready in 6 minutes! Glaze, add toppings and serve. Change up the spices in the burgers and use middle eastern blend, or garam masala or taco spice. Change up the glaze to choice. We had these with regular tomato, onion, lettuce. and some with chopped cucumber, radish, onion, tomato, cilantro salad. 

******MORE BURGER RECIPES FROM THE BLOG******

PINTO BEAN BROCCOLI LENTIL BURGERS: https://www.veganricha.com/pinto-bean-broccoli-lentil-burgers/

SPICY CHICKPEA LENTIL BURGERS: https://www.veganricha.com/spicy-chickpea-lentil-burgers/

LENTIL WALNUT BURGERS: https://www.veganricha.com/lentil-walnut-rice-burgers/

RED LENTIL CAULIFLOWER BURGER: https://www.veganricha.com/red-lentil-cauliflower-burger-with/

COOKBOOKS BY RICHA HINGLE (VEGAN RICHA): https://www.veganricha.com/mybooks/

Connect with me on Social Media:

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/VeganRicha

INSTAGRAM: https://instagram.com/veganricha

PINTEREST: https://www.pinterest.com/veganricha/

TWITTER: https://twitter.com/veganricha

Music: Epidemic Sound 

#burgerrecipe #veganburger #veganmeatloafrecipe #quinoarecipe #veganricha #easyveganrecipes

recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups cooked lentils (brown lentils, I usually use Indian brown (whole masoor))
½ cup chopped or grated carrots
½  cup breadcrumbs  (or use coarsely ground oats or gf breadcrumbs to make gf)
3 tbsp or more ketchup (or use bbq sauce)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the lentils and quinoa, drain and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the lentils and quinoa, drain and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic and jalapeno and cook for 5 minutes. or until translucent
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic and jalapeno and cook for 5 minutes. or until translucent

recipeInstructions.text: Add celery, carrots, thyme, oregano, and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until the veggies are tender. Add some currants or dried cranberries at this point and mix in. .
recipeInstructions.name: Add celery, carrots, thyme, oregano, and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until the veggies are tender. Add some currants or dried cranberries at this point and mix in. .

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked veggies, flaxmeal, cooked lentils and quinoa to a bowl and mix. Mash the mixture using potato masher or hands, so that atleast half the lentils and quinoa get well mashed. (you still want some whole lentils).
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cooked veggies, flaxmeal, cooked lentils and quinoa to a bowl and mix. Mash the mixture using potato masher or hands, so that atleast half the lentils and quinoa get well mashed. (you still want some whole lentils).

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the sauces, nutritional yeast, and mix well. You can also add 1/4 tsp coarsely crushed fennel seeds at this point.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the sauces, nutritional yeast, and mix well. You can also add 1/4 tsp coarsely crushed fennel seeds at this point.

recipeInstructions.text: Add breadcrumbs or coarsely ground oats and mix in. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Add more sauces, herbs and salt if needed. (To check if the mixture is the right consistency, make a burger patty. If the mixture is too sticky or pasty, add more breadcrumbs. If it is too crumbly and doesn't stick easily, add some wet sauce or 1 flax egg (1 tbsp flax meal mixed in 2.5 tbsp water). Chill the mixture for 10 -15 mins if the mixture is too moist.
recipeInstructions.name: Add breadcrumbs or coarsely ground oats and mix in. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Add more sauces, herbs and salt if needed. (To check if the mixture is the right consistency, make a burger patty. If the mixture is too sticky or pasty, add more breadcrumbs. If it is too crumbly and doesn't stick easily, add some wet sauce or 1 flax egg (1 tbsp flax meal mixed in 2.5 tbsp water). Chill the mixture for 10 -15 mins if the mixture is too moist.

recipeInstructions.text: Shape into burger patties or use a cookie cutter to make patties.
recipeInstructions.name: Shape into burger patties or use a cookie cutter to make patties.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and pan fry the patties with or without oil for 4 to 6 mins , or until golden brown on both sides.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and pan fry the patties with or without oil for 4 to 6 mins , or until golden brown on both sides.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the ingredients under glaze. Add a glaze to the burger patties in last 2 mins of cooking or add the glaze just before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the ingredients under glaze. Add a glaze to the burger patties in last 2 mins of cooking or add the glaze just before serving.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve over greens, toppings of choice with additional glaze. I served the burgers with a chopped salad of cucumber, onion, radish, tomato mixed with salt, pepper, lemon and cilantro. with a side of Sweet Potato Fries
recipeInstructions.name: Serve over greens, toppings of choice with additional glaze. I served the burgers with a chopped salad of cucumber, onion, radish, tomato mixed with salt, pepper, lemon and cilantro. with a side of Sweet Potato Fries
